00054 enum cli_result_code { 
00055     cli_ok = 0,
00056     cli_bad_address = -1,
00057     cli_connection_refused = -2,
00058     cli_database_not_found = -3, 
00059     cli_bad_statement = -4,
00060     cli_parameter_not_found = -5,
00061     cli_unbound_parameter = -6,
00062     cli_column_not_found = -7,
00063     cli_incompatible_type = -8,
00064     cli_network_error = -9,
00065     cli_runtime_error = -10,
00066     cli_bad_descriptor = -11,
00067     cli_unsupported_type = -12,
00068     cli_not_found        = -13,
00069     cli_not_update_mode  = -14,
00070     cli_table_not_found  = -15,
00071     cli_not_all_columns_specified = -16, 
00072     cli_not_fetched = -17,
00073     cli_already_updated = -18, 
00074     cli_table_already_exists = -19, 
00075     cli_not_implemented = -20,
00076     cli_xml_parse_error = -25,
00077     cli_backup_failed = -26
00078 };
00079     
00080 enum cli_var_type { 
00081     cli_oid,
00082     cli_bool, 
00083     cli_int1, 
00084     cli_int2,
00085     cli_int4,
00086     cli_int8,
00087     cli_real4,
00088     cli_real8,
00089     cli_decimal, /* not supported */
00090     cli_asciiz,  /* zero terminated string */
00091     cli_pasciiz, /* pointer to zero terminated string */
00092     cli_cstring, /* not supported */
00093     cli_array_of_oid,
00094     cli_array_of_bool, 
00095     cli_array_of_int1, 
00096     cli_array_of_int2,
00097     cli_array_of_int4,
00098     cli_array_of_int8,
00099     cli_array_of_real4,
00100     cli_array_of_real8,
00101     cli_array_of_decimal, 
00102     cli_array_of_string,
00103     cli_any,      /* use the same type for column as stored in the database */
00104     cli_datetime,  /* time in seconds since 00:00:00 UTC, January 1, 1970. */
00105     cli_autoincrement,  /* column of int4 type automatically assigned value during record insert */
00106     cli_rectangle,
00107     cli_wstring,
00108     cli_pwstring,
00109     cli_array_of_wstring,
00110     cli_unknown
00111 };

00164 // structure used to represent array field in structure extracted by cli_execute_query
00165 typedef struct cli_array_t { 
00166     size_t size;      // number of elements in the array
00167     void*  data;      // pointer to the array elements
00168     size_t allocated; // internal field: size of allocated buffer 
00169 } cli_array_t;

00171 /*********************************************************************
00172  * cli_open
00173  *     Establish connection with the server 
00174  * Parameters:
00175  *     server_url - zero terminated string with server address and port, 
00176  *                  for example "localhost:5101", "195.239.208.240:6100",...
00177  *     max_connect_attempts  - number of attempts to establish connection
00178  *     reconnect_timeout_sec - timeput in seconds between connection attempts
00179  * Returns:
00180  *     >= 0 - connectiondescriptor to be used in all other cli calls
00181  *     <  0 - error code as described in cli_result_code enum
00182  */
00183 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_open(char const* server_url, 
00184                               int         max_connect_attempts,
00185                               int         reconnect_timeout_sec);
00186 
00187 enum cli_open_attributes { 
00188     cli_open_default    = 0x0, 
00189     cli_open_readonly   = 0x1, 
00190     cli_open_truncate   = 0x2,
00191     cli_open_concurrent = 0x4
00192 };
00193 /*********************************************************************
00194  * cli_create
00195  *     Create connection to the local database
00196  * Parameters:
00197  *     databaseName - name of the database 
00198  *     fileName - path to the database file 
00199  *     transactionCommitDelay - trasnaction commit delay (specify 0 to disable)
00200  *     openAttr - mask of cli_open_attributes
00201  *     initDatabaseSize - initial size of the database
00202  *     extensionQuantum - database extension quantum
00203  *     initIndexSize - initial size of object index
00204  *     fileSizeLimit - limit for file size (0 - unlimited)
00205  * Returns:
00206  *     >= 0 - connection descriptor to be used in all other cli calls
00207  *     <  0 - error code as described in cli_result_code enum
00208  */
00209 
00210 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_create(char_t const* databaseName, 
00211                                 char_t const* filePath, 
00212                                 unsigned    transactionCommitDelay, 
00213                                 int         openAttr, 
00214                                 size_t      initDatabaseSize,
00215                                 size_t      extensionQuantum,
00216                                 size_t      initIndexSize,
00217                                 size_t      fileSizeLimit);
00218     
00219 /*********************************************************************
00220  * cli_create_replication_node
00221  *     Create connection to the local database with support of replication
00222  * Parameters:
00223  *     nodeId - node identifier: 0 <= nodeId < nServers
00224  *     nServers - number of replication nodes (primary + standby)
00225  *     nodeNames - array with URLs of the nodes (address:port)
00226  *     databaseName - name of the database 
00227  *     fileName - path to the database file 
00228  *     transactionCommitDelay - trasnaction commit delay (specify 0 to disable)
00229  *     openAttr - mask of cli_open_attributes (to allow concurrent read access to replication node, 
00230  *                cli_open_concurrent attribute should be set) 
00231  *     initDatabaseSize - initial size of the database
00232  *     extensionQuantum - database extension quantum
00233  *     initIndexSize - initial size of object index
00234  *     fileSizeLimit - limit for file size (0 - unlimited)
00235  * Returns:
00236  *     >= 0 - connection descriptor to be used in all other cli calls
00237  *     <  0 - error code as described in cli_result_code enum
00238  */
00239 
00240 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_create_replication_node(int         nodeId,
00241                                                  int         nServers,
00242                                                  char*       nodeNames[],
00243                                                  char const* databaseName, 
00244                                                  char const* filePath, 
00245                                                  int         openAttr, 
00246                                                  size_t      initDatabaseSize,
00247                                                  size_t      extensionQuantum,
00248                                                  size_t      initIndexSize,
00249                                                  size_t      fileSizeLimit);
00250 
00251 /*********************************************************************
00252  * cli_close
00253  *     Close session
00254  * Parameters:
00255  *     session - session descriptor returned by cli_open
00256  * Returns:
00257  *     result code as described in cli_result_code enum
00258  */
00259 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_close(int session);
00260 
00261 /*********************************************************************
00262  * cli_statement
00263  *     Specify SubSQL statement to be executed at server
00264  *     Binding to the parameters and columns can be established       
00265  * Parameters:
00266  *     session - session descriptor returned by cli_open
00267  *     stmt    - zero terminated string with SubSQL statement  
00268  * Returns:
00269  *     >= 0 - statement descriptor
00270  *     <  0 - error code as described in cli_result_code enum
00271  */
00272 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_statement(int session, char const* stmt);
00273 
00274 /*********************************************************************
00275  * cli_parameter
00276  *     Bind parameter to the statement
00277  * Parameters:
00278  *     statement  - statememt descriptor returned by cli_statement
00279  *     param_name - zero terminated string with parameter name  
00280  *                  Paramter name should start with '%'
00281  *     var_type   - type of variable as described in cli_var_type enum.
00282  *                  Only scalar and zero terminated string types are supported.
00283  *     var_ptr    - pointer to the variable
00284  * Returns:
00285  *     result code as described in cli_result_code enum
00286  */
00287 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_parameter(int         statement,
00288                                    char const* param_name, 
00289                                    int         var_type,
00290                                    void*       var_ptr);
00291 
00292 /*********************************************************************
00293  * cli_column
00294  *     Bind extracted column of select or insert statement
00295  * Parameters:
00296  *     statement   - statememt descriptor returned by cli_statement
00297  *     column_name - zero terminated string with column name  
00298  *     var_type    - type of variable as described in cli_var_type enum
00299  *     var_len     - pointer to the variable to hold length of array variable.
00300  *                   This variable should be assigned the maximal length
00301  *                   of the array/string buffer, pointed by var_ptr.
00302  *                   After the execution of the statement it is assigned the 
00303  *                   real length of the fetched array/string. If it is large 
00304  *                   than length of the buffer, then only part of the array
00305  *                   will be placed in the buffer, but var_len still will 
00306  *                   contain the actual array length. 
00307  *     var_ptr     - pointer to the variable
00308  * Returns:
00309  *     result code as described in cli_result_code enum
00310  */
00311 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_column(int         statement,
00312                                 char const* column_name, 
00313                                 int         var_type, 
00314                                 int*        var_len, 
00315                                 void*       var_ptr);
00316 
00317 
00318 typedef void* (CLI_CALLBACK_CC *cli_column_set)(int var_type, void* var_ptr, int len);
00319 typedef void* (CLI_CALLBACK_CC *cli_column_get)(int var_type, void* var_ptr, int* len);
00320 
00321 typedef void* (CLI_CALLBACK_CC *cli_column_set_ex)(int var_type, void* var_ptr, int len, 
00322                                    char const* column_name, int statement, void const* data_ptr, void* user_data);
00323 typedef void* (CLI_CALLBACK_CC *cli_column_get_ex)(int var_type, void* var_ptr, int* len, 
00324                                    char const* column_name, int statemen, void* user_data);
00325 
00326 /*********************************************************************
00327  * cli_array_column
00328  *     Specify get/set functions for the array column
00329  * Parameters:
00330  *     statement   - statememt descriptor returned by cli_statement
00331  *     column_name - zero terminated string with column name  
00332  *     var_type    - type of variable as described in cli_var_type enum
00333  *     var_ptr     - pointer to the variable
00334  *     set         - function which will be called to construct fetched 
00335  *                   field. It receives pointer to the variable, 
00336  *                   length of the fetched array and returns pointer to th 
00337  *                   array's elements
00338  *     get         - function which will be called to update the field in the 
00339  *                   database. Given pointer to the variable, it should return 
00340  *                   pointer to the array elements and store length of the
00341  *                   array to the variable pointer by len parameter
00342  *     user_data   - pointer to user specific data passed to get and set functions
00343  * Returns:
00344  *     result code as described in cli_result_code enum
00345  */
00346 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_array_column(int            statement,
00347                                       char const*    column_name, 
00348                                       int            var_type,
00349                                       void*          var_ptr,
00350                                       cli_column_set set,
00351                                       cli_column_get get);
00352     
00353 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_array_column_ex(int               statement,
00354                                          char const*       column_name, 
00355                                          int               var_type,
00356                                          void*             var_ptr,
00357                                          cli_column_set_ex set,
00358                                          cli_column_get_ex get, 
00359                                          void*             user_data);

00361 enum { 
00362     cli_view_only, 
00363     cli_for_update
00364 };

00366 /*********************************************************************
00367  * cli_fetch
00368  *     Execute select statement.
00369  * Parameters:
00370  *     statement  - statememt descriptor returned by cli_statement
00371  *     for_update - not zero if fetched rows will be updated 
00372  * Returns:
00373  *     >= 0 - success, for select statements number of fetched rows is returned
00374  *     <  0 - error code as described in cli_result_code enum
00375  */
00376 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_fetch(int statement, int for_update);
00377 
00378 /*********************************************************************
00379  * cli_insert
00380  *     Execute insert statement.
00381  * Parameters:
00382  *     statement  - statememt descriptor returned by cli_statement
00383  *     oid        - object identifier of created record. 
00384  * Returns:
00385  *     status code as described in cli_result_code enum
00386  */
00387 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_insert(int statement, cli_oid_t* oid);
00388 
00389 /*********************************************************************
00390  * cli_get_first
00391  *     Get first row of the selection.
00392  * Parameters:
00393  *     statement  - statememt descriptor returned by cli_statement
00394  * Returns:
00395  *     result code as described in cli_result_code enum
00396  */
00397 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_get_first(int statement);
00398 
00399 /*********************************************************************
00400  * cli_get_last
00401  *     Get last row of the selection.
00402  * Parameters:
00403  *     statement  - statememt descriptor returned by cli_statement
00404  * Returns:
00405  *     result code as described in cli_result_code enum
00406  */
00407 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_get_last(int statement);
00408 
00409 /*********************************************************************
00410  * cli_get_next
00411  *     Get next row of the selection. If get_next records is called
00412  *     exactly after cli_fetch function call, is will fetch the first record
00413  *     in selection.
00414  * Parameters:
00415  *     statement  - statememt descriptor returned by cli_statement
00416  * Returns:
00417  *     result code as described in cli_result_code enum
00418  */
00419 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_get_next(int statement);
00420 
00421 /*********************************************************************
00422  * cli_get_prev
00423  *     Get previous row of the selection. If get_next records is called
00424  *     exactly after cli_fetch function call, is will fetch the last record
00425  *     in selection.
00426  * Parameters:
00427  *     statement  - statememt descriptor returned by cli_statement
00428  * Returns:
00429  *     result code as described in cli_result_code enum
00430  */
00431 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_get_prev(int statement);
00432 
00433 /*********************************************************************
00434  * cli_skip
00435  *     Skip specified number of rows. 
00436  * Parameters:
00437  *     statement  - statememt descriptor returned by cli_statement
00438  *     n          - number of objects to be skipped
00439  *                - if "n" is positive, then this function has the same effect as
00440  *                     executing cli_get_next() function "n" times.
00441  *                - if "n" is negative, then this function has the same effect as
00442  *                     executing cli_get_prev() function "-n" times.
00443  *                - if "n"  is zero, this method just reloads current record
00444  * Returns:
00445  *     result code as described in cli_result_code enum
00446  */
00447 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_skip(int statement, int n);
00448 
00449 /*********************************************************************
00450  * cli_seek
00451  *    Position cursor to the record with specified OID
00452  * Parameters:
00453  *     statement   - statememt descriptor returned by cli_statement
00454  *     oid         - object identifier of the record to which cursor should be positioned
00455  * Returns:
00456  *     >= 0 - success, position of the record in the selection
00457  *     <  0 - error code as described in cli_result_code enum
00458  */
00459 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_seek(int statement, cli_oid_t oid);
00460 
00461 
00462 /*********************************************************************
00463  * cli_get_oid
00464  *     Get object identifier of the current record
00465  * Parameters:
00466  *     statement  - statememt descriptor returned by cli_statement
00467  * Returns:
00468  *     object identifier or 0 if no object is seleected
00469  */
00470 cli_oid_t FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_get_oid(int statement);
00471 
00472 /*********************************************************************
00473  * cli_update
00474  *     Update the current row in the selection. You have to set
00475  *     for_update parameter of cli_fetch to 1 in order to be able 
00476  *     to perform updates. Updated value of row fields will be taken
00477  *     from bound column variables. 
00478  * Parameters:
00479  *     statement   - statememt descriptor returned by cli_statement
00480  * Returns:
00481  *     result code as described in cli_result_code enum
00482  */
00483 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_update(int statement);
00484 
00485 /*********************************************************************
00486  * cli_remove
00487  *     Remove all selected records. You have to set
00488  *     for_update parameter of cli_fetch to 1 in order to be able 
00489  *     to remove records. 
00490  * Parameters:
00491  *     statement   - statememt descriptor returned by cli_statement
00492  * Returns:
00493  *     result code as described in cli_result_code enum
00494  */
00495 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_remove(int statement);
00496 
00497 /*********************************************************************
00498  * cli_remove_current
00499  *     Remove currently selected record. You have to set
00500  *     for_update parameter of cli_fetch to 1 in order to be able
00501  *     to remove records.
00502  * Parameters:
00503  *     statement   - statememt descriptor returned by cli_statement
00504  * Returns:
00505  *     result code as described in cli_result_code enum
00506  */
00507 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_remove_current(int statement);
00508 
00509 /*********************************************************************
00510  * cli_free
00511  *     Deallocate statement and all associated data
00512  * Parameters:
00513  *     statement   - statememt descriptor returned by cli_statement
00514  * Returns:
00515  *     result code as described in cli_result_code enum
00516  */
00517 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_free(int statement);
00518 
00519 /*********************************************************************
00520  * cli_close_cursor
00521  *     Close current cursor
00522  * Parameters:
00523  *     statement   - statememt descriptor returned by cli_statement
00524  * Returns:
00525  *     result code as described in cli_result_code enum
00526  */
00527 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_close_cursor(int statement);

00529 /*********************************************************************
00530  * cli_commit
00531  *     Commit current database transaction
00532  * Parameters:
00533  *     session - session descriptor as returned by cli_open
00534  * Returns:
00535  *     result code as described in cli_result_code enum
00536  */
00537 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_commit(int session);
00538 
00539 /*********************************************************************
00540  * cli_precommit
00541  *     Release all locks set by transaction. This methods allows other clients
00542  *     to proceed, but it doesn't flush transaction to the disk.
00543  * Parameters:
00544  *     session - session descriptor as returned by cli_open
00545  * Returns:
00546  *     result code as described in cli_result_code enum
00547  */
00548 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_precommit(int session);

00550 
00551 /*********************************************************************
00552  * cli_lock
00553  *      Exclusively lock database (FastDB set locks implicitely, explicit exclusive lock may be needed to avoid deadlock caused by lock upgrade)
00554  * Parameters:
00555  *     session - session descriptor as returned by cli_open
00556  * Returns:
00557  *     result code as described in cli_result_code enum
00558  */
00559 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_lock(int session);
00560 
00561 /*********************************************************************
00562  * cli_abort
00563  *     Abort current database transaction
00564  * Parameters:
00565  *     session - session descriptor as returned by cli_open
00566  * Returns:
00567  *     result code as described in cli_result_code enum
00568  */
00569 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_abort(int session);

00571 
00572 enum cli_field_flags { 
00573     cli_hashed           = 1, /* field should be indexed usnig hash table */
00574     cli_indexed          = 2, /* field should be indexed using B-Tree */
00575     cli_cascade_delete   = 8,  /* perfrom cascade delete for for reference or array of reference fields */
00576     cli_autoincremented  = 16 /* field is assigned automaticall incremented value */
00577 };
00578 
00579 typedef struct cli_field_descriptor { 
00580     enum cli_var_type type;
00581     int               flags;
00582     char const*       name;
00583     char const*       refTableName;
00584     char const*       inverseRefFieldName;
00585 } cli_field_descriptor;
00586 
00587 /*********************************************************************
00588  * cli_describe
00589  *     Describe fields of specified table
00590  * Parameters:
00591  *     session - session descriptor as returned by cli_open
00592  *     table   - name of the table
00593  *     fields  - address of the pointer to the array of fields descriptors, 
00594  *               this array should be later deallocated by application by cli_free_memory()
00595  * Returns:
00596  *     >= 0 - number of fields in the table
00597  *     < 0  - result code as described in cli_result_code enum
00598  */
00599 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_describe(int session, char const* table, cli_field_descriptor** fields);
00600 
00601 typedef struct cli_field_layout {
00602     cli_field_descriptor desc;
00603     int                  offs;
00604     int                  size;
00605 } cli_field_layout;
00606 
00607 /*********************************************************************
00608  * cli_describe_layout
00609  *     Describe fields layout of specified table
00610  * Parameters:
00611  *     session - session descriptor as returned by cli_open
00612  *     table   - name of the table
00613  *     fields  - address of the pointer to the array of fields layout descriptors, 
00614  *               this array should be later deallocated by application by cli_free_memory()
00615  *     rec_size - pointer to the location to receive size of the record. This size can be used by application to allocate buffer for cli_execute_query function
00616  * Returns:
00617  *     >= 0 - number of fields in the table
00618  *     < 0  - result code as described in cli_result_code enum
00619  */
00620 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_describe_layout(int session, char const* table, cli_field_layout** fields, int* rec_size);
00621 
00622 /*********************************************************************
00623  * cli_get_field_size
00624  *     Calculate field size
00625  * Parameters:
00626  *     fields  - array with fields descriptors obtained using cli_describe function
00627  *     field_no - number of the field
00628  */
00629 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_get_field_size(cli_field_descriptor* fields, int field_no);

00716 /*********************************************************************
00717  * cli_set_error_handler
00718  *     Set FastDB erro handler. Handler should be no-return function which perform stack unwind.
00719  * Parameters:
00720  *     session   - session descriptor as returned by cli_open
00721  *     handler   - error handler
00722  *     context   - error handler context: pointer to the user specific data
00723  *                  which will be passed to thr handler
00724  * Returns:
00725  *     previous handler
00726  */
00727 enum cli_error_class { 
00728     cli_no_error, 
00729     cli_query_error,
00730     cli_arithmetic_error,
00731     cli_index_out_of_range_error,
00732     cli_database_open_error,
00733     cli_file_error,
00734     cli_out_of_memory_error,
00735     cli_deadlock,
00736     cli_null_reference_error,
00737     cli_lock_revoked,
00738     cli_file_limit_exeeded,
00739     cli_inconsistent_inverse_reference,
00740     cli_database_read_only,
00741     cli_assertion_failed,
00742     cli_access_to_deleted_object,
00743     cli_no_current_record,
00744     cli_readonly_cursor,
00745     cli_incompatible_schema_change
00746 };
00747 typedef void (CLI_CALLBACK_CC *cli_error_handler)(int error, char const* msg, int msgarg, void* context); 
00748 cli_error_handler FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_set_error_handler(int session, cli_error_handler new_handler, void* context);

00771 /*********************************************************************
00772  * cli_attach
00773  *    Attach thread to the database. Each thread except one opened the database should first
00774  *    attach to the database before any access to the database, and detach after end of the work with database
00775  * Parameters:
00776  *     session - session descriptor returned by cli_open
00777  * Returns:
00778  *     result code as described in cli_result_code enum
00779  */
00780 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_attach(int session);
00781 
00782 /*********************************************************************
00783  * cli_detach
00784  *    Detach thread from the database. Each thread except one opened the database should perform 
00785  *    attach to the database before any access to the database, and detach after end of the work with database
00786  * Parameters:
00787  *     session - session descriptor returned by cli_open
00788  *     detach_mode - bit mask representing detach mode
00789  * Returns:
00790  *     result code as described in cli_result_code enum
00791  */
00792 enum cli_detach_mode {
00793     cli_commit_on_detach          = 1,
00794     cli_destroy_context_on_detach = 2
00795 };
00796 
00797 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_detach(int session, int detach_mode);

00810 typedef struct cli_database_monitor {
00811     int n_readers;
00812     int n_writers;
00813     int n_blocked_readers;
00814     int n_blocked_writers;
00815     int n_users;
00816     size_t database_size;
00817 } cli_database_monitor;
00818 
00819 /*********************************************************************
00820  * cli_get_database_state
00821  *    Obtain information about current state of the database
00822  * Parameters:
00823  *     session - session descriptor returned by cli_open
00824  *     monitor - pointer to the monitor structure. The folloing fields are set:
00825  *       n_readers: number of granted shared locks
00826  *       n_writers: number of granted exclusive locks
00827  *       n_blocked_reader: number of threads which shared lock request was blocked
00828  *       n_blocked_writers: number of threads which exclusive lock request was blocked
00829  *       n_users: number of processes openned the database
00830  *       database_size: size of database
00831  * Returns:
00832  *     result code as described in cli_result_code enum
00833  */
00834 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_get_database_state(int session, cli_database_monitor* monitor);

00840  *    Set trace function which will be used to output FastDB trace messages
00841  * Parameters:
00842  *     func - pointer to trace function which receives trace message terminated with new line character
00843  */
00844 typedef void (CLI_CALLBACK_CC *cli_trace_function_t)(char* msg);
00845 void FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_set_trace_function(cli_trace_function_t func);

00848 /*********************************************************************
00849  * cli_prepare_query
00850  *     Prepare SubSQL query statement. 
00851  * Parameters:
00852  *     session - session descriptor returned by cli_open
00853  *     query   - query string with optional parameters. Parameters are specified
00854  *               as '%T' where T is one or two character code of parameter type using the same notation
00855  *               as in printf: %d or %i - int, %f - float or double, %ld - int8, %s - string, %ls - wstring, %p - oid...
00856  *               Parameter of cli_rectangle_t* type has format %R, cli_time_t type - %t
00857  * Returns:
00858  *     >= 0 - statement descriptor
00859  *     <  0 - error code as described in cli_result_code enum
00860  */
00861 int FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_prepare_query(int session, char const* query);

00916 /*********************************************************************
00917  * cli_join_transaction
00918  *    Associate current threads with specified transaction context,
00919  *    It allows to share single transaction between multiple threads.
00920  * Parameters:
00921  *     session - session descriptor returned by cli_open
00922  *     ctx     - transaction context created by cli_create_transaction_context
00923  * Returns:
00924  *     result code as described in cli_result_code enum
00925  */

00933  */
00934 void FASTDB_DLL_ENTRY cli_remove_transaction_context(cli_transaction_context_t ctx);
